p: As a zoonotic pathogens and reemerging arbovirus, Zika virus (ZIKV) has caught extensive attention since its outbreak in Brazil 2015 [ 1]. ZIKV belongs to the genus Flavivirus, family Flaviviridae. It shares many biological and molecular characteristics in symptoms, genome and pathogenicity with other family members such as dengue virus (DENV), yellow fever virus (YFV), West Nile virus (WNV) and Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) [ 2]. Approximately 80% of Zika infections are asymptomatic [ 3, 4], the remainder usually develop non-specific clinical symptoms such as mild fever, rash, arthralgia, myalgia, conjunctivitis and headache [ 5]. Nevertheless, sometimes ZIKV infection can lead to much severer neurological complications, such as Guillain-Barre Syndrome in adults [ 6, 7] and microcephaly in neonates [ 8].
